snippet: Oklahoma City, the No. 44-ranked television market, with 712,630 households — smaller than No. 36 San Antonio — may attract casual sports fans with its team’s dynamic, dunk-heavy offense.
abstract: Richard Sandomir TV Sports column asserts that the NBA finals between Oklahoma City Thunder and Miami Heat will test small-market Thunder's national appeal; says that the Thunder, led by stars Kevin Durant and Russell Westbrook, play a dynamic, dunk-heavy offense that can attract casual sports fans.
lead_paragraph: Oklahoma City, the No. 44-ranked television market, with 712,630 households — smaller than No. 36 San Antonio — may attract casual sports fans with its team’s dynamic, dunk-heavy offense.

headline.seo: N.B.A. Finals to Test Small-Market Thunder’s National Appeal
headline.main: Test of the Thunder’s National Appeal
headline.print_headline: Finals Will Test Small-Market Thunder’s National Appeal
